intro: Zieria insularis, commonly known as the island zieria, is a small, evergreen shrub native to the island of Tasmania. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, glossy leaves. It produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers in spring, which are followed by small, woody fruits. Zieria insularis is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as under dense forest canopies.
